messages.title: Your last chance to save Ipswich Buses
messages.content: The Tories and Liberals running the council are still planning to sell off Ipswich Buses to a private operator. When this has happened in other towns bus fares have risen, services have been cut and jobs have been lost.

messages.title: More and more potholes
messages.content: Ipswich’s roads are full of potholes because of poor maintenance. Yet the Conservatives at the Town Hall have refused to listen to Labour’s call for proper investment to make our roads safe again.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Opposes the sale of Ipswich Buses to a private operator, highlighting increased fares, reduced services, and job losses in other towns after similar sales.
Calls for proper investment in road maintenance to address the issue of potholes, criticizes Conservatives for ignoring Labour’s calls for investment.

images.caption: Ipswich Buses with a potential private operator signage and Lindsey Rawlingson standing next to a pothole.
